---
name: global-tech-stack
description: Configure the Django project tech stack including Poetry for dependency management, Docker for containerization, and all required tools and packages. Use this skill when adding dependencies with Poetry, configuring pyproject.toml, setting up Docker or docker-compose, choosing libraries for specific features, configuring Celery for background tasks, setting up Redis caching, integrating authentication packages, or making technology decisions for the project.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When adding new Python dependencies with Poetry
- When configuring pyproject.toml for dependencies and tools
- When creating or modifying Dockerfile or docker-compose.yml
- When choosing between different libraries for a feature
- When setting up Celery workers or beat scheduler
- When configuring Redis for caching or as a message broker
- When integrating JWT authentication with djangorestframework-simplejwt
- When setting up pytest-django and test tooling
- When configuring code formatters (black, isort) and linters (flake8)
- When setting up Sentry or other monitoring tools
- When deploying with Gunicorn or Uvicorn
- When configuring WhiteNoise for static files
- When setting up django-cors-headers or django-filter
- When making decisions about the project's technology choices
- When running docker-compose commands for development

# Global Tech Stack

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle global tech stack.

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
